greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: G.f. = (1 + 4 * g.f. for A096661)/(1 + 2 Sum_{m>=1} (-1)^m*q^(m^2)).
comment: a(0) = 1; for n>0, a(n) = 2*A026832(n) (i.e., essentially Fine's numbers L(n) multiplied by 2).

The number of odd-even overpartitions of n: an odd-even overpartition of n is an overpartition of n with the smallest part odd and such that the difference between successive parts is odd if the smaller part is nonoverlined and even otherwise - see Yang 2017. - _Peter Bala_, Mar 29 2017
reference: N. J. Fine, Basic Hypergeometric Series and Applications, Amer. Math. Soc., 1988; p. 56, Eq. (26.28).
link: Vaclav Kotesovec, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Min-Joo Jang, Asymptotic behavior of odd-even partitions, arXiv:1703.01837v1 [math.NT], 2017.
formula: Conjectural g.f.: 1 + 2*Sum_{n >= 1} q^(n*(n+1)/2)/( (1 + q^n) * Product_{k = 1..n} 1 - q^k ). - _Peter Bala_, Feb 19 2021
mathematica: nmax = 60; Flatten[{1, Rest[CoefficientList[Series[2*Sum[x^(2*k - 1) QPochhammer[-x^(2*k), x], {k, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x]]}] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Mar 28 2017 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 15 2004
